data.description:
PvP: Fluted + Ricochet + Killing Wind + MKC/Headseeker [this is the best min/max roll +15 handing, +15 stability, +15 range and no stat negatives + killing wind bonuses]
OR any range barrel and stability MW
PvP: Don’t
PvP: It’s a sword in PvP, anything works
PvP: It’s a sword it doesn’t matter

Surplus + Frenzy combo buff handling, reload, stability (10/20/50) and damage, handing, reload respectively (20% buff, 30 stat points. This means you can get up to 80 stat points to handling and reload and 50 to stability.

Overflow and MKC have very poor synergy with each other, with MKC unable to be procced while overflow is active. While these are both excellent perks, the combo is not worth keeping

Frenzy and Vorpal now give the same damage bonus (15%), so it’s your choice which perk. Vorpal affects majors [champs] and bosses, Frenzy affects all enemies and gives a +50 stat bonus to reload speed but takes some time to proc

Pulses do appear to be range capped, so like Cold Denial, it’s best to focus on stability if you get Killing Wind since KW adds +20 range, + 50 mobility, and +~40  handling. This pulse has standard zoom and iron sights like those on Redrix.

This sniper has some interesting rolls. With KC and MKC it can get ohk body shots, and Vorpal makes it one of the ways to counter a behemoth super. However, these all roll in the same slot as the handling perks, so you are giving up better ads and feel for these build perks

Recombination x5 can one body all resilience levels. Slideshot and Killing Wind both boost OHKO range and do stack when both are active. Heritage’s base range stat is good enough to spec into a handling barrel and Assault mag (no range stat boost should be needed).

One For All is much better on primaries, but some may prefer Rampage due to the ease to proc

Rampage makes this 3 tap at x2 stacks on all Res [x1 stack can 3 tap at 3 res or lower

Reconstruction and HIR work extremely poorly together, as HIR only procs on the last ¼ of the original mag size, not the newly increased mag size.

HIR and Under Pressure on the other hand work excellently together, as they both proc on the same part of the mag

This sword is an interesting case. Without the combo of Relentless Strikes + Whirlwind Blade to allow it to stack up against other swords for boss damage, you have to get creative. Relentless + En Guard can give some good quick burst of damage, while Thresh + Assassins Blade could have it’s place against Taniks as Div.

PvP: It really doesn’t matter

Of the 140 HCs, Waking has lower base range at 38 therefore it cannot really be a max range weapon, however, it does have great base handing.
Due to the inability to fight at the extended ranges of 140s, sight choice can come down to which is preferred visually. Despite this, the sights which are normally ignored because of the stat penalties they incur (Sureshot & Crossfire) can be worth it to push the range out as far as possible

60 base reload + 10 from mag perk + 10/20/40 form vorpal would be sufficient for reloads. Outlaw would max out reload (+60) but its not as consistently proc’d in higher level content.

Dungeon Perks: Surplus, Vorpal, Thresh

Hi-Cal can stunlock and knockback PvE enemies
Max ammo is known to be 20 [100 mag stat]

Shattered Throne: Quickdraw

Surrounded could be good but it’s activation range is so short.
Lower velocity results in better tracking.

Rapid hit affects knocking speed, stability seems to have no impact on bows.
With x5 Swash, the bow can 1 tap to the head in PvP, making it a pretty good legendary pairing for bowswaps
Don’t bother using this rocket for PvP, there are better options. However for PvE it’s one of two Precision Frame rockets if you’re more interested in the tracking than a damage perk

20 base zoom (+4 over the others and +2 over Horror Story with Med scope) makes this best in class for range. Arrowhead + Rico + Killing Wind + MKC/HIR 
KW + 68 range (=88 range) = 38m which beats 100 range 16 zooms by nearly 2M.
25 zoom at base - 5 more than Nightwatch and Vouchsafe
Randy’s Throwing Knife returns with Rapid Hit/KC, but unfortunately other damage perks such as OfA or Frenzy outshine KC in PvE

Not as strong of rolls as Interference, but still can get 7 spike grenades with backup mag.

PvE: Spike grenades benefit from reduced blast radius as that shifts more damage to impact damage. Velocity barrels are acceptable, but avoid Confined Launch and Volatile Launch if using spike grenades.

PvP: Inverse of Spikes, we want increased blast radius when using Proximity Grenades - but not at the cost of other stats.
Rapid Hit is an S tier perk and ramps up the stability and recoil of the weapon - one burst and you could have several stacks of the perk primed and ready.

PvE: Spike grenades benefit from reduced blast radius as that shifts more damage to impact damage. Velocity barrels are acceptable, but avoid Confined Launch and Volatile Launch if using spike grenades.

PvP: Inverse of Spikes, we want increased blast radius when using Proximity Grenades - but not at the cost of other stats.
Headstone makes this sidearm excellent when combined with a proper character stasis build, offering easy crystals without ability usage to either break or stand next to depending on your build

The medium zoom scopes add +3 / 4 to zoom which has a massive impact on damage drop off. Model 8 Red pushes it to 17 zoom which makes this the best in slot SMG by a long shot (get it? Because it has more range?) pushing a 60 stat SMG to 20M base range.

Deciding between Kill Clip and Iron Reach comes down to deciding what you want your smg to be. Iron Reach gives it an extra 3m of range (and with smgs, every metre counts) making it a better dueling weapon, while Kill Clip’s damage buff gives it a nutty ttk and an excellent snowball machine
Scopes affect zoom which has a massive effect on drop off. Red Dot Micro is best in slot.
When using Iron Grip, make sure you run a hand cannon loader mod. This returns you to the base reload of the weapon and make sure you lose nothing
If you chose Iron Grip, then Flared Magwell/Alloy Mag become more wanted perks to help counter the greatly decreased reload of Iron Grip
The sights on Forward Path have a massive impact on the user experience due to sight picture and muzzle flash. Find your favorite.

Despite Iron Reach greatly increasing the range, this gun has to stand up against the stat monster that is Palindrome. Even while fully statted into Range, it loses to Pali by 3m. While this might be an alternative for those who dislike the zoom that Rangefinder gives, it’s better off being used on an Arc Subclass with Elemental Capacitor for a huge Handling stat or relegated to the trash

With nearly 60 range it almost caps out on the maximum aim assist that snipers get, and with Full Bore it reaches 100 range, adding to that cone optimisation. This sniper will get you kills you wouldn’t believe would hit, if you can only get past the telescope zoom
This weapon has the same “bugged” reticle as Gridskipper (it moves a whole lot as you strafe). It may bother you, it may not. But if the weapon feels off, that is why.

PvE: Spike grenades benefit from reduced blast radius as that shifts more damage to impact damage. Velocity barrels are acceptable, but avoid Confined Launch and Volatile Launch if using spike grenades.

PvP: Inverse of Spikes, we want increased blast radius when using Proximity Grenades - but not at the cost of other stats.
Lowering the speed of the rocket gives it more time to turn, thus improving the tracking the slightest bit

Crimils is currently the max range 120 HC with RF and KC/Playload. However, the actual range benefits are pretty marginal since 40M is baseish range for 120s. You can go all in on range, but its not really necessary.

One of two 120 handcannons which can still 2 tap.
Curated (Shuro Chi) PvE: Fluted + Light Mag + Outlaw + Explosive Payload
PvP: (don’t)

Curated (Riven) PvE and PvP: Corkscrew + Light Mag + KillClip + High Impact Reserves

Even though lightweight pulses struggle in PvE and PvP, the curated roll is a solid performer for the archetype.
Curated (Kali) PvE: Extended + Light Mag + FTTC + Rampage
Don’t use this rocket launcher. Just don’t
Arrowhead Brake takes recoil direction to 100.

The final column does not have any perks worth searching for in PvE, so Swash has been included for it’s potential to give the first few shots some better damage. But it’s not worth killing a roll just because it doesn’t have Swash
Fluted + Counterbalance Mod makes recoil direction 100.
Swash is included for the bodyshot potential of x5 swash, best paired with a melee build
One of two current available snipers that can roll Firmly Planted + Opening Shot - they stack for max accuracy bonuses
Under Pressure is essentially a better version of Heating Up which doesn’t need a kill. However you do need to choose between the two best in slot perks for fusions, Under Pressure and Firmly Planted
This gun has an interesting PvE roll with Frenzy or Demo, but for PvP either Summoner or Gnawing Hunger is preferred

This gun can get some really nice rolls, but the most important part is Kill Clip, allowing it to two tap after the damage nerf, Depending on how the gun feels for you, the split minor stat boost barrels and steady rounds can help to make up for the terrible base stats

While Subsistance does work against MKC and KC, this weapon is really lacking for good perks, and generally you use enough bullets against slightly tougher red bars that you don’t get all your ammo back, allowing you to proc the reload based perks
Some excellent PvE rolls on the best MG archetype with a rare elemental type
PvP: It’s a sword, it doesn’t matter
The 180 3 tap machine returns, now un-sunset. Box Breathing allows the scout to 3 tap to the head in PvP
Curated Bane of Sorrow returns with Outlaw + Dfly
The 180 3 tap machine returns, now un-sunset. Box Breathing allows the scout to 3 tap to the head in PvP
Curated Bane of Sorrow returns with Outlaw + Dfly
This is an aggressive frame shotgun that can have the highest Handling of any in the game on an Arc subclass with Elemental Capacitor and either Threat Detector or Surplus.
Judgement can only 2 tap with MKC x 3, but x1 and x2 both improve the usability (2c1b at x1, 1c2b at x2)
Only Rampage x3 will affect the ttk, but both other levels of rampage improve the optimal headshot ratio
PvP: Anything, You one heavy everything

PvP: Any, You 1 heavy everything

En Guarde best in slot for PvP, but ya know, OFA could be a lot of fun in PvE.

You’re a Hunter begging for a lightweight weapon, you’re using this for dodge cooldown reduction and to do the funny run in PvP
PvP: Any, you 1 heavy anything in the game

Opening Shot is arguably the best in slot perk. Rangefinder is generally the go to (it does add ~3M of base range) but Hawkmoon is a run and gun weapon (in my opinion) - if you want range, run a 120 or Luna Faction boots. Opening Shot gives serious bonus to accuracy on ground and in air and helps guarantee landing the first crit (or 7 stack OHKO if you wait for perk to reset).

Moving Target is nearly worthless due to high base AA stat.
Really, only vorpal matters, then I would prioritize handling and recoil direction. Base range 71M (64 range stat) max range 76.6M (86 range stat) 81.8M+ maxed stat (86 stat and Killing Wind Active)
Max range stat is key with the 3.2.1 shotgun update. Looking for ~80 range.
45 recoil direction is very low, so arrowhead would be a great choice. 16 base zoom is not too bad. 10 range stat points = 1.69M increase to range drop off

1-2p and TB increase burst DPS but do not increase total DPS due to the time it takes to proc the perk. Pick the perks that have the most synergy with your playstyle.

Slideshot and Killing Wind each add ~20 range stat making 86+ range possible. However, pellet spread RNG is the determinant factor for one hit kills.
Desperado returns on High Impact pulses, bringing with it the 0.4 second ttk. This is the best primary ttk in the game outside of a few select exotics or combos . GET THIS GUN WITH DESPERADO

Worthy Variant
PvE: Barrel Shroud/Corkscrew/Full Choke + Assault Mag + Field Prep/ALH + 12 Punch/Swash

PvP: Full Choke/Barrel Shroud + Assault Mag/Accurized + Threat Detector/Surplus + Opening Shot/Celerity/Elemental Capacitor

Chosen Variant
PvE: Barrel Shroud/Corkscrew/Full Choke + Assault Mag + ALH/Surplus + Trench/Demo

PvP: Full Choke/Corkscrew/Barrel Shroud + Assault Mag/Accurized + Surplus + Opening Shot/Celerity

Splicer Variant
PvE: Fluted/Corkscrew/Hammer Forged + Appended/Tac Mag + Surplus/Ensemble + Vorpal/HIR

PvP: Fluted/Hammer Forged + Accurized + Moving Target/Surplus + Snapshot/Opening Shot

Worthy Variant
PvE: Fluted/Corkscrew/Hammer Forged + Appended/Tac Mag + Field Prep + Vorpal

PvP: Fluted / Hammer Forged + Accurized + Snapshot + Opening Shot

Worthy Variant
PvE: Fluted/Corkscrew/Hammer Forged + Liquid Coil + Field Prep/Grave Robber + MKC/Disruption Break

PvP: Fluted/Smallbore/Polygonal + Particle Repeater/Projection Fuse + Firmly Planted + Elemental Cap

Chosen Variant
PvE: Fluted/Corkscrew/Hammer Forged + Liquid Coils + Slideshot + Vorpal/HIR

PvP: Fluted/Smallbore/Polygonal + Particle Repeater/Projection Fuse + Slideshot/Quickdraw + HIR/Kickstart

Kickstart is a nice perk to reduce the charge time slightly, but has a very small period to proc it (needs charging during slide to ensure that you don’t lose the perk half way through the burst), and requires you to play a certain way to best use the perk (sprinting with a fusion out in order to get the perk to proc, leaving you vulnerable to a shotgun push or ranged primary fire)

Worthy Variant
PvE: Hard/Quick Launch + Impact Casing + Field Prep/Tracking + Clown Cartridge/Cluster Bomb

PvP: Confined/Volatile Launch + Impact Casing + Tracking + Cluster Bomb

Chosen Variant
PvE: Hard/Quick Launch + Impact Casing + ALH/AA/Impluse + Chain/Lasting Impression/Cluster

PvP: Confined/Volatile Launch + Impact Casing + Tracking + Chain/Cluster
PvP: It’s a sword in PvP. You’re using it for 3 peaking or heavy attack, and you don’t need any specific perks for that
Desperado returns on High Impact pulses, bringing with it the 0.4 second ttk. This is the best primary ttk in the game outside of a few select exotics or combos . GET THIS GUN WITH DESPERADO

Worthy Variant
PvE: Barrel Shroud/Corkscrew/Full Choke + Assault Mag + Field Prep/ALH + 12 Punch/Swash

PvP: Full Choke/Barrel Shroud + Assault Mag/Accurized + Threat Detector/Surplus + Opening Shot/Celerity/Elemental Capacitor

Chosen Variant
PvE: Barrel Shroud/Corkscrew/Full Choke + Assault Mag + ALH/Surplus + Trench/Demo

PvP: Full Choke/Corkscrew/Barrel Shroud + Assault Mag/Accurized + Surplus + Opening Shot/Celerity

Splicer Variant
PvE: Fluted/Corkscrew/Hammer Forged + Appended/Tac Mag + Surplus/Ensemble + Vorpal/HIR

PvP: Fluted/Hammer Forged + Accurized + Moving Target/Surplus + Snapshot/Opening Shot

Worthy Variant
PvE: Fluted/Corkscrew/Hammer Forged + Appended/Tac Mag + Field Prep + Vorpal

PvP: Fluted / Hammer Forged + Accurized + Snapshot + Opening Shot

Worthy Variant
PvE: Fluted/Corkscrew/Hammer Forged + Liquid Coil + Field Prep/Grave Robber + MKC/Disruption Break

PvP: Fluted/Smallbore/Polygonal + Particle Repeater/Projection Fuse + Firmly Planted + Elemental Cap

Chosen Variant
PvE: Fluted/Corkscrew/Hammer Forged + Liquid Coils + Slideshot + Vorpal/HIR

PvP: Fluted/Smallbore/Polygonal + Particle Repeater/Projection Fuse + Slideshot/Quickdraw + HIR/Kickstart

Kickstart is a nice perk to reduce the charge time slightly, but has a very small period to proc it (needs charging during slide to ensure that you don’t lose the perk half way through the burst), and requires you to play a certain way to best use the perk (sprinting with a fusion out in order to get the perk to proc, leaving you vulnerable to a shotgun push or ranged primary fire)

Worthy Variant
PvE: Hard/Quick Launch + Impact Casing + Field Prep/Tracking + Clown Cartridge/Cluster Bomb

PvP: Confined/Volatile Launch + Impact Casing + Tracking + Cluster Bomb

Chosen Variant
PvE: Hard/Quick Launch + Impact Casing + ALH/AA/Impluse + Chain/Lasting Impression/Cluster

PvP: Confined/Volatile Launch + Impact Casing + Tracking + Chain/Cluster
PvP: It’s a sword in PvP. You’re using it for 3 peaking or heavy attack, and you don’t need any specific perks for that

Kill Clip does not improve TTK - just forgiveness and effective range
PvP “God Roll” Hammer/(Range Barrel) + Accurized + Explosive + Opening Shot + Range MW

Frenzy is +50 to reload, so that perk alone puts Fatebringer at max reload speed. Loader will still add a scalar so it will be faster.

Rolls are all about perk synergy so here are some notes on perk synergy re Fatebringer.
Kill Clip does not boost Explosive Payload damage, just the impact damage
Explosive and Firefly is the OG combo, but Explosive sometimes interferes with Firefly explosions
Good PvE Combos:
Explosive + Frenzy
Rewind + Frenzy/Firefly
Osmosis + AJ (?)
Suboptimal PvE combos, but good perks
Rewind + Kill Clip
Explosive + Kill Clip
PvP: Handling Mw

Kill Clip does not improve TTK - just forgiveness and effective range
PvP “God Roll” Hammer/(Range Barrel) + Accurized + Explosive + Opening Shot + Range MW

Frenzy is +50 to reload, so that perk alone puts Fatebringer at max reload speed. Loader will still add a scalar so it will be faster.

Rolls are all about perk synergy so here are some notes on perk synergy re Fatebringer.
Kill Clip does not boost Explosive Payload damage, just the impact damage
Explosive and Firefly is the OG combo, but Explosive sometimes interferes with Firefly explosions
Good PvE Combos:
Explosive + Frenzy
Rewind + Frenzy/Firefly
Osmosis + AJ (?)
Suboptimal PvE combos, but good perks
Rewind + Kill Clip
Explosive + Kill Clip
PvP: Handling Mw
7 is the magic number for Triple Tap, but ammo return with 6 ammo is the same as 7. You proc HIR at the same time with 6 vs 7 mag.
Extended Barrel has hidden range benefit on this weapon - source: DCP Bungie Dev Interview

Base mag of 12 (9 + backup mag) = 17 shots with Triple Tap, 13 mag = 19 shots
Extended Mag is a poor choice due to low base reload speed.

Lower range than some of the other 180 offerings (see Nature of the Beast with Rangefinder)

This pulse has the highest range in it’s archetype. With 22 base zoom and Killing Wind proc’d, it can reach up to 50m before it encounters damage falloff. Despite this amazing range the maps are not set up for such long range weapons, and combined with Legal Action’s mediocre perks it cannot beat Messenger for best in slot
Under Pressure gives increased aim assist when on low ammo, essentially operating as a minor version of Opening Shot
Unless you have a Worthy Varient Astral Horizon spec’d into Handling, this will be the fastest drawing Aggressive Frame shotgun one can get in the kinetic slot
With a full spec into range, this smg can reach 20m and can work as a worse version of Multimach. Due to the lack of further range increasing perks or good damage perks, that’s where it will stay
The Night watch you get as part of the New Light quest is the curated version, and is currently the only way to get this roll on the weapon. Make sure you keep it.
If hit ammo cap of 7, then run spec mod, otherwise more ammo is better

Honestly, this archetype is just so bad everywhere and has been for a long time.

Rapid Fire shotguns have a base mag of 7 so Slideshot loads two shells on activation.

SMGs are sensitive to range stat, 56 base range can hit full damage at 15M, max range 17.8M

Ammo cap seems to be 41 so backup mag + tac/appended = Extended
PvP: It doesn’t matter
Curated (PvP): Volatile Launch + Impact Casing + Tracking Module + Cluster Bombs

PvE: Spike grenades benefit from reduced blast radius as that shifts more damage to impact damage. Velocity barrels are acceptable, but avoid Confined Launch and Volatile Launch if using spike grenades.

PvP: Inverse of Spikes, we want increased blast radius when using Proximity Grenades - but not at the cost of other stats.

PvE: Spike grenades benefit from reduced blast radius as that shifts more damage to impact damage. Velocity barrels are acceptable, but avoid Confined Launch and Volatile Launch if using spike grenades.

PvP: Inverse of Spikes, we want increased blast radius when using Proximity Grenades - but not at the cost of other stats.

Spike grenades benefit from reduced blast radius as that shifts more damage to impact damage. Velocity barrels are acceptable, but avoid Confined Launch and Volatile Launch if using spike grenades.

Inverse of Spikes, we want increased blast radius when using Proximity Grenades - but not at the cost of other stats.
PvP: It’s a sword in PvP it doesn’t matter
Good perk table, but adaptive frame seems to be relatively weak compared to other frames.
